get.description: Lists all repositories of the specified user, without showing its content.

Returns one repository and its unresolved elements.
Skills and their relations are handled as IDs and need to be resolved on the client-side.

post.description: Lists all skills matching given attributes.

get.description:
Returns one resolved repository and its elements.
Skills and their relations are resolved at the server.

post.description: Creates a new skill repository for the specified user.
Creates a new skill at the specified repository and returns the created skill.
Adapts a repository and returns the adapted it.

put.description: Adapts a skill at the specified repository and returns the adapted skill.

post.description: Creates a new nugget at the specified repository and returns the created nugget.
Creates a new empty learning path for the specified owner (orga-id).

get.description: Returns all LearningPaths of the specified owner (orga-id).

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter by owner if value is given, otherwise return all

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number - set up value if pagination is needed

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items per page - set up value if pagination is needed

patch.description:
Partially updates a LearningPath. This function considers a tristate logic:
- null: The field shall be deleted (reset to default), this is supported only by optional fields
- undefined: The field shall not be changed
- value: The field shall be updated to the given value

To specify a suggested ordering you need to pass the affected learning unit IDs in the array "recommendedUnitSequence" in the desired order.
The old order will always be completely overwritten if a "recommendedUnitSequence" is defined, i.e., the recommendation of unspecified units will be deleted for this LearningPath.
The old order will be kept if "recommendedUnitSequence" is undefined/not passed as parameter.

Default ordering of first 5 units of the first DigiMedia chapter:
```json
{
  "recommendedUnitSequence": ["2001", "2002", "2005", "2003", "2004"]
}
```

delete.description: Deletes a drafted Learning-Path or returns a 403 error.

get.description:
Re-validates an existing learning path. Checks:
- The path contains cycles
- The goal can be reached (if actually a path exists)

post.description: Creates a new learningUnit at the specified repository and returns the created learningUnit.

Computes the optimal learning path to learn the specified skill(s).

Parameters:
- goal (mandatory): The list of skills to be learned.
- userId (optional): If specified, path will be computed and optimized for the specified user, e.g., considering learned skills and learning behavior.
- optimalSolution (optional): If unspecified, algorithm will use a fast, greedy approach to find a path. If true, the algorithm will try to find an optimal path, at cost of performance.




Default path for learning Java (skill 1009)
```json
{
  "goal": ["1009"]
}
```

Path for learning DigiMedia (skills 2501 - 2512) for user 2001, ensure performant computation
```json
{
  "goal": ["2501", "2502", "2503", "2504", "2505", "2506", "2507", "2508", "2509", "2510", "2511", "2512"],
  "userId": "2001",
  "optimalSolution": false
}
```

Analysis a skill (goal) to find the missing skills in the learning path.

Parameters:
- goal (mandatory): The list of skills to be learned.

Returns:
- If the return path is empty, then there are no learning units for the skill.





Default path for learning Java (skill 1009)
```json
{
"goal": ["1009"]
}
```
Creates an empty user profile for learners.

delete.description: Deletes the specified user-profile (setting it to inactive).

get.description: If we specify a user ID, we get their career profile(s). Otherwise, get all profiles.

info.title: Skill Repository
info.description: The API description of the Skill Repository.

owner.description: Used to validate that the user is the owner of the target repository.

id.description: Must be a referenced ID of a TASK in MLS.
Must be a referenced ID of a TASK in MLS.

goal.description: The list of skills to be learned.

userId.description:
If specified, path will be computed and optimized for the specified user.
This includes:
- taking into account the user's current skills
- taking into account the user's learning behavior

optimalSolution.description:
If unspecified, algorithm will use a fast, greedy approach to find a path.
If true, the algorithm will try to find an optimal path, at cost of performance.

goal.description: The list of skills to be learned.

units.description: The personalized path of the learner to be stored.

originPathId.description:
The pre-defined learning path which was personalized for the learner.
Must be defined, unless `goal` is defined.

goal.description:
A personal learning goal of the learner.
Must be defined, unless `originPathId` is defined.

Optional, if the path was selected based on a pre-defined learning paths.

goal.description: The learning goals of the path.
